intro: Papaver pseudostubendorfii, commonly known as the Stubendorf poppy, is a rare and striking member of the Papaveraceae family. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from deep red to orange. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Papaver pseudostubendorfii is considered a species of conservation concern.
